intro: Anemonastrum schantungensis, commonly known as the Schantung sandwort, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its delicate, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces numerous stamens that give it a fluffy appearance. Anemonastrum schantungensis is often found in dry, open habitats such as roadsides and disturbed areas.
